poem:
Title: "The Allegory of the Gap"

A pledge to seal the Darién,
Won't refine the human yen.
For safe passageways abide,
Less in terrain, more in pride.
Fierce jungles bear no decree -
Serene evidences of liberty. 
In the pulp of danger grows,
Not a Gap, but the rose 
Of choice, of want, of fear,
In every torched life, unclear.
